io.github.arkobat.kolorkarl.common

Class Hitbox

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.arkobat.kolorkarl.common.Hitbox

  • public class Hitbox
extends java.lang.Object
    Represent the hitbox of objects, to check for collision

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hitbox(float width, float height)
      Creates a HitBox without any offset
      Hitbox(float width, float height, float offsetX, float offsetY)
      Creates a HitBox with the possibility to create an offset.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getHeight()
      How high an object is
      float getOffsetX()
      Objects textures can have different offsets, which is used to display the asset in the right location.
      float getOffsetY()
      Like getOffsetX(), this is used to calculate the offset on the Y axis
      float getWidth()
      How width an object is

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hitbox

        public Hitbox(float width,
              float height)
        Creates a HitBox without any offset
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the object
        height - The height of the object

      • Hitbox

        public Hitbox(float width,
              float height,
              float offsetX,
              float offsetY)
        Creates a HitBox with the possibility to create an offset. If the object do not have any offset, take a look at Hitbox(float, float)
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the object
        height - The height of the object
        offsetX - The offset on the X axis
        offsetY - The offset on the Y axis

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        How width an object is
        Returns:
        The width of the object

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        How high an object is
        Returns:
        the height of the object

      • getOffsetX

        public float getOffsetX()
        Objects textures can have different offsets, which is used to display the asset in the right location. If a asset have 3 invisible pixels before the Hitbox actually starts, the offset should be -3
        Returns:
        The objects offset on the X axis

      • getOffsetY

        public float getOffsetY()
        Like getOffsetX(), this is used to calculate the offset on the Y axis
        Returns:
        The objects offset on the Y axis
